0.controls: To move between slides, use the arrow keys to your right.

1.controls: You can select the SD card with the buttons under the screen. Each SD contains different stuff.

0.text: I am a 23 year old developer from Zaragoza, Spain

1.text: I am currenly studying computer science while I work as a programmer.

2.text: I also have an Associate Degree in web development and i have undergone a lot of courses, mainly about ML and UX.

3.text: My other passion is art in any form. I love music, designing stuff and photography (obviously).

4.text: Just so you know me a bit better, here's some of my music taste!

5.text: And my top artists at the moment:

6.text: I also like videogames, and recently I've been playing:

0.title: My web stack
0.text1: I've worked with a broad range of technologies, both front and backend.
0.text2: But my favourites are definitely Three.js and Next.js

1.text1: I am also really interested in ML and coding in general.
1.text2: I have experience with Python, and curretly I am learnign Rust.

2.text1: I love challenges and if there's a hackathon or a jam, I'll be there!
2.text2: Here are some of the projects I've worked on:

3.text1: In my last hackathon I worked on a smart watering system.
3.text2: We trained a neural network to detect different kinds of plants.

4.text1: Depending on the specific plant needs and current weather and humidity conditions, it was watered with just the right amount of water.
4.text2: This was all automatic with an Arduino and a humidity sensor, so healthy plants without having to water them manually!

5.text1: We also made a game version, where when you answeredd correctly questions about the environment, the watering mechanism would trigger.
5.text2: Kinda like duolingo, but with plants!

7.text: I also worked on a exopanetary systems visualizer able to procedurally recreate faithful replicas of planets and stars discovered by the NASA

8.text: We also developed what we called the 'music of the stars': a positional sound system where every stellar body emited a disctincive sound depending on its mass and temperature.

9.text: We made it with Godot, and the coolest part of the project was implementing VR!

10.text: It's not the same without sound!

11.text1: One of my first 'big' projects was saight: an app to help people with visual impediments to interact with their surroundings
11.text2: I used a computer vision model to detect objects in real time and inform the user throgh TTS

12.text: I also implemented voice control and other cool features like face detection and connection to an LLM providing the objects detected in the environment as context.

0.text1: Besides programming, I also like to design, animate or just create stuff.
0.text2: I play bass in a band and design our posters and covers.

5.text: and it's visualizer with synced movement
